Award.AwardTitle: Student Support: PowderMET Conference on Powder Metallurgy; San Antonio, Texas; June 17-20, 2018

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports 40 graduate and undergraduate students studying at US institutions to participate in the 2018 PowderMET sponsored by the Metal Powder Industries Federation. This premier powder metallurgy conference acts as a bridges between industries, government laboratories, and academic institutions. The award provides student participants with opportunities to exchange ideas with leading researchers and engineers from worldwide industrial and governmental facilities, as well as with students and faculty from both domestic and international schools. In addition to nurturing a powder metallurgy community, participants will learn the latest research areas and results in powder metallurgy.

This project provides the student participants with opportunities to exchange ideas with leading researchers and engineers from worldwide industrial and governmental facilities, as well as with students and faculty from both domestic and international universities. In addition to nurturing a global powder metallurgy (traditional press & sinter, metal injection molding, isostatic pressing, and metal additive manufacturing) vision, participants will learn the latest research areas and results in the fields of interest. These opportunities will not only improve the participants' knowledge in the field but also develop scientists and engineers who are ideally suited to craft the next generation of designs in powder metallurgy that will push the nation's manufacturing capabilities.

POR.DRECONTENT:
PowderMET Conference on Powder Metallurgy; San Antonio, Texas; June 17-20, 2018 was led by: 

POWDERMET2018 Technical Co-Chairmen

Animesh Bose, FAPMI, Desktop Metal

Scott Davis, GKN Hoeganaes Corporation

AMPM2018 Technical Co-Chairmen

Todd Grimm, T.A. Grimm & Associates

Juha Kotila, EOS Finland 

Below is a summary of the combined conferences:

  • Over 850 attendees from 25 countries.
  • 58 technical sessions, 4 Special Interest Programs, and the 6 Talk ‘N Technology sessions featured 217 presentations.
  • 46 posters resulted in 1 Outstanding Poster award and 5 Posters of Merit awards, including 5 Posters of Merit awards to NSF recipients Kyle H. Bear, Pennsylvania State University—DuBois, Babak Jahani, North Dakota State University, Mohsen Ziaee, University of South Florida, Trevor Clark, University of California—Riverside, and Yash B. Parikh, Texas A&M University.
  • Each NSF student provided a 10-minute synopsis of their poster during the “Talk ‘N Technology” sessions in the exhibition hall.
  • 129 exhibitors showcasing the latest technological advances in metal powders, equipment and services.
  • Keynote Presentation “Automotive Outlook: Evolution or Revolution” by Casey Selecman, IHS Markit.
  • “State of the North American PM Industry” by MPIF President John Sweet, FMS Corporation.
  • Chad Spore, John Deere, received the MPIF Vanguard Award, recognizing industry champions from end-user companies contributing to the expansion of powder metallurgy applications.
  • Stephen Mashl, Michigan Technical University, and Alberto Molinari, University of Trento, Italy, were elevated to APMI International Fellow status, recognizing contributions to the technology, practice, and business of the industry. 
  • Teresa Stillman, MPIF, received the Distinguished Service to Powder Metallurgy Award celebrating her 45 years of service to the PM industry.
  • All attended the PM Awards Luncheon featuring the winners of the Design Excellence Awards winners; the Industry Luncheon featuring industry awards, and the North American Höganäs sponsored NSF breakfast. 
  • The Main Social Event was Boots and Blue Jeans: A Texas BBQ.
  • All NSF recipients signed in each morning before 7:45 and were provided a 12-month complimentary membership to APMI International and certificate of participation.  
  • Each NSF student was provided a mentor from the MPIF Technical Board who contacted the student prior to the conferences, each day at the conferences, and performed an exit interview after the conclusion of the conferences. 

 

Examples of post-conference emails from participating students to the conference organizers: 

Hello MPIF team,

I would like to thank you all for making the AMPM 2018 conference a wonderful experience for us students. This was my first year at the conference as a presenter and also as a NSF grant recipient. The knowledge I have gained and the connections I have made will be extremely valuable for me in the future. I hope to stay connected with you all and am already looking forward to the next year’s conference.

Thank you once again!

Regards,

Anagh Deshpande

 

 

Good morning MPIF team,

Thank you for providing me the opportunity to share my work at POWDERMET 2018. It was great to be a participant and get to know more about the powder metallurgy industry and network with research community. I greatly appreciate the work and efforts by the MPIF team in making it a great success for POWDERMET 2018 and a wonderful experience for me.

Thanks a lot for providing me support with the NSF student grant which made it possible for me attend the conference and make best of it. I expect the learning experience received will definitely benefit achieve my research and career goals.

Best regards

Paramjot Singh

 

Dear Jim, Paul, Debby and Stephanie,

Hope you are doing well. I am writing this email to thank you all for providing me the opportunity to attend one of the best conferences in the US. I always learn a lot of important things from various peoples with different backgrounds. It’s very interesting and exciting to see people appreciating our work and providing the constructive criticism to take my work to a different level. It wouldn’t have been possible without the MPIF team and I am always grateful for that.

I hope our path crosses again in the future. Please convey my thanks to other people in the MPIF team.

Sincerely,

Harish Irrinki
